3.author: StragglingShadow
3.body: Im interested. I love reading cult stories. Are there any survivors who have written books? I like survivor narratives a lot.

3.author: igmrlm
3.body:
Oh shit.. hmm.. if anybody was going to write a book it likely would be me..
This picture was taken in 2013, by me.. I censored it so you can't tell who the kids are but those are my family and friend. The Emojis used are the closest ones I could find to the actual expressions on the kids faces.. the girl was so excited to show me the spoon and have her picture taken with it, it made no sense at all.. maybe it was an unconscious cry for help or something I don't know.. they seemed genuinely happy to show it to me..

I never really thought of writing a book.. oh my what have you done 🤣

3.author: StragglingShadow
3.body: If you ever do, Ill read it!

3.author: igmrlm
3.body:
My parents take great offense at being called a cult but they fit many of the criteria, I spent a lot of time in my young adult years trying to explain to people how they were semantically slightly different from Westboro Baptist Church.. they really do not like being compared to Westboro but for all intents and purposes, the only real difference is that my dad believes that there's still some hope for the world to be revived and turned back to God where Westboro believes that everything is fucked and there's no changing it.

I haven't done a lot of long form writing, most of my expression is through YouTube videos, I may make a series about it but I don't know.. my mom watches my videos and I care a lot about her..

Maybe 20 years from now I don't know 😕

3.author: StragglingShadow
3.body: Im glad you escaped, regardless. It takes courage to do that.

4.author: Apprehensive_Rip8990
4.body:
Mine was 900mm. Wait for the rest of the story. They then asked to put rent up by 250 a month, so I said to fix the oven space. They put a side cabinet in, but it wasn't even (we weren't home). We have a trampoline in the garden. No ladder so we used a chair. They sawed off a leg of the chair to wedge between the side cabinet!

https://preview.redd.it/145z9b9kywea1.jpeg?width=3024&format=pjpg&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=cc1bc0affa05e36105eaf43fc1c066df3f459d25

4.author: ACDrinnan
4.body:
Fuck me, that's bad.

This is why I'm kinda glad my landlord is my local council. Don't get me wrong, it would be nice to own this home but rent is less than 350 per month, they can't kick me out (unless I was to completely stop paying rent and start terrorising the neighbourhood) I can decorate the whole house as I see fit, as long as it's up to their standard. If the boiler breaks, there's a leak etc they fix it and they have to keep the electrical work in the house up to the latest regulations.  


The reason I have a smaller oven than the space is my fault really. I've been installing kitchens for over 20 years. I have a new integrated single oven and touch screen induction hob I could put it, I've been in here for over 2 years, I just haven't been bothered to change the worktops yet, since they are not free standing appliances.

4.author: Apprehensive_Rip8990
4.body: Yeah, my rent is 1700 a month.. Would love a council house. I think btl should be banned. My house is ex council.

4.author: ACDrinnan
4.body: Agreed . Buying your council home was meant to help people get on the property ladder, not to exploit those that couldn't

6.author: BridgetTheBee
6.body: It really isn't cringey at all. The Guerrilla Girls are an amazing group of artists, I saw a seminar they did where they showed lists of art galleries that had more women in paintings inside than they had ever had women artists featured. Women are constantly IN art but have consistently been kept out of the spaces. They do a lot of cool stuff.

6.author: No-Distribution5174
6.body: Only parts I thought were cringey were misspelling success and not being on shows with men. I'm sure they do great work, but the whole "oh thank God there's no men on this show" vibe just seems toxic and something I want little to do with.

6.author: BridgetTheBee
6.body: Oh that's not what that means at all!! They support men artists as well and want to show with men :) what that point is saying is the only time women artists seem to get attention is when a gallery puts on a women's/feminist show, which is sort of sucky because they just want to be treated like artists, not specifically feminine artists. It's like how all the rest of the points are worded like "good" things but are actually bad. they just want there to be more women since art is always portrayed as so open and equal but women show so much less.

6.author: No-Distribution5174
6.body: Ohhhhhh shit okay that makes a ton of sense. Well, my bad for assuming worse than they really are. Sounds like a pretty cool group of creatives. And that is totally BS that women aren't showing as much as men. Every visual artist I've personally known has been a woman. Thanks a ton for the context. I totally take back calling it cringe. Have a nice night :))

6.author: BridgetTheBee
6.body: No problem :D I personally haven't seen the discrepancy in men/women showing either in my circles, but I'm in the local art scene with cool people. It seems big professional fine art is where the barriers come up and where there are very few women showing (as if that circle doesn't have a shit ton of problems already lol).

9.author: edwardsfan7
9.body:
I mean he will get away with it because no one will investigate it. No one is calling the cops because they ate pizza and got sick. 

I'm not a teenager btw. How about learn to grow up? You think it's perfectly ok for people to steal OPs food, and then get mad when we try to help him out with a solution. How about the fact that stealing peoples stuff is wrong??

9.author: Expert_Canary_7806
9.body: Stealing stuff is obviously wrong, but if you think that means the police (and OPs employer!) aren't gonna care about them leaving poisoned food lying around in the work fridge, knowing other people will eat it, you must have no experience whatsoever of the real world...

9.author: edwardsfan7
9.body:
I mean you are talking like everyone will know that it's poisoned and he will get into trouble. Like grow up. This isnt CSI Miami. 

Let me tell you the real reality of it all. Even if he did poison it, no one will know at all. Even if people get sick or what not, laxatives take hours or more to respond usually. People will chalk it up as a stomach bug or something. No one is gunna think back to when they stole pizza at lunch and think that was the reason, and again it would be very hard to prove that was the reasoning. With food poisoning cases you need to have the stomach pumped within a few hours, or the actual food involved, or you have no evidence.

9.author: Expert_Canary_7806
9.body:
Okay buddy, think whatever you like if it makes you happy. 

The fact is (if OP even scrolls this far down the comment thread), poisoning your coworkers for petty revenge is a really bad idea and the only people telling you its a good idea are the idiots like this guy, who like to talk tough online because they haven't finished puberty yet and don't understand how the world works.

15.author: stereonix
15.body: If they're regulated, there's less of a chance manufacturers can slip something extremely toxic into the product (think asbestos filters for cigs in the 20th century). I still see no issue with asking manufacturers and sellers to be licensed—tax revenue from weed and weed adjacent products has already been committed to great causes in [legal states.](https://www.fool.com/research/marijuana-tax-revenue-by-state/)

15.author: ToughDuodenum
15.body: Ok, but Regulations and safety standards aren’t in question or being disputed, those already exist, and I implore manufacturers to participate so long as your not buying CBD/THC from gas stations lol Governmental overreach for the sole purpose of tacking on another tax is the rub I’m emphasizing.

15.author: ToughDuodenum
15.body: Any additional hurdles that manufactures have to jump through trickle down to the consumer. So while paying a small price for “comfort,” is worth it to some max it’s the principle of the matter. I don’t like Uncle Sam getting theirs greedy paws on more small businesses.

15.author: stereonix
15.body:
> So long as you're not buying CBD/thd from gas stations

That's exactly the kind of shit we're trying to prevent—the industry is not well regulated enough if you're able to buy something harmful as long as it's from the "wrong place."

Taxes are good. Cry on the libertarian sub if you want people to agree with you.

15.author: ToughDuodenum
15.body: Nah, eff that. Consumption of anything at a gas station outside of a bottle of water is risky. Adults are allowed to make decisions, good or bad lol

15.author: ToughDuodenum
15.body: “Taxes are a good thing” lol that’s comical. Why are people fleeing from CA and NY in droves then? GTFOH with all that. Sure, taxes are necessary, everyone can pay their fair sure via sales tax, state tax, etc. but not when it’s convoluted and running amok  because local governments tie them into demanding licenses under he guise of “regulatory standards” 🤦‍♂️

15.author: stereonix
15.body: That's not true, and even if it were it shouldn't *be* that way. Regulation (and the taxes that come with it) are worth it for the general public. If you don't like what your elected officials are doing, do something about it.

I'm going to make pulled pork sandwiches next week and I'm going to make the buns from scratch dough and all (ciabatta cheddar and onion) with apple cider marinade pulled pork (yes making the apple cider too) and I don't think it will need BBQ even but I'm making that as well for it just in case

19.author: yamumsntme

21.author: viper7747
21.body:
If that's your hand in the photo, then you must be washing a lot of dishes by hand to have them look like that at only 32. I'm 82, and my hands don't look anywhere near like what yours do. 

The good news is that teeth can be fixed. The sooner you do it, the less damage you'll have to get repaired. 

By the way, as I am old, I've been around a lot of likewise old people. If you ask them what they would have done differently in their life, most of them will say that they wish they had taken better care of their teeth. If you're strapped for cash, or don't have dental insurance, one way to save money on dental work is to volunteer to be a patient at your local dental school. Worst case scenario, if they don't do it right the first time, you can go back for free.

21.author: RayneBeauRhode
21.body:
You could not be more correct 😂 I have eczema on my hands and I do not help it, I don’t wear gloves. I clean often and I used to clean terribly neglected apartments for a living. Many times the cleaning solutions would seep through my gloves.

Thank you for the awesome money-saving tip! There’s probably a second extraction in my future 😩

21.author: viper7747
21.body: You should seek professional dental advice, but in my experience getting a crown for an existing tooth is better than having an extraction, and then needing to have a removable appliance (dentures). As  for your hands, have you tried Eucerin? It's available over the counter, is very effective on skin problems, and has all the ingredients that the high priced lotions have, without the cost. Around $8 for a very large jar.

21.author: RayneBeauRhode
21.body:
Oh, I’ll absolutely get a professional opinion, haha. I’m making an appt. with a dentist today.

I do use Eucerin, I carry a tube of it in my purse. I just don’t keep up as much as I should because my eczema doesn’t bother me and the “look” of my hands isn’t something weighing on my head. But when it gets itchy it really does help actually.

Probably should use it more 😂

25.author: RedolenceLove
25.body:
>You are indeed confused. 

I was being sarcastic, u/Mountain_Offer1348.

>There is a very good reason that the natural and normal reaction is to loathe and avoid the person who slaughters your mother.

So, are you saying that she was mentally challenged? If you read the article, you would understand that she was a kind, loving person. People deal with their trauma differently. They heal differently. Are you saying she was not normal? Are you saying she wasn't "natural"? 

>An expected result from bizarrely bad judgment? You bet.

"An expected result"? Really? In what way is murder an expected result? It's actually against human nature, psychologically, to murder your fellow man. She is the victim of a horrendous murder. She is not at fault. I hope she rests in peace.

29.author: Yargon_Kerman
29.body: Maybe I'm forgetting my terminology here, but surely the exterior angle should be 300 degrees?

29.author: Carribean-Diver
29.body:
Nope.

> The interior angles of a triangle always add up to 180° while the exterior angles of a triangle are equal to the sum of the two interior angles that are not adjacent to it. Another way to calculate the exterior angle of a triangle is to subtract the angle of the vertex of interest from 180°.

[Source](https://www.calculator.net/triangle-calculator.html)

OP is correct, and the "Correct" answer is wrong.

29.author: Yargon_Kerman
29.body:
Yeah ik the "correct" answers are backwards, but i guess it's a terminology thing because the exterior angle of any given vertex would be 300°. 120° only makes sense if you're not actually talking about the reflex angle on the 'outside' of the vertex.

This formula basically just calculates 180 - <interior angle>, so it's calculating the angle required to, for lack of a better term, "flatten" the lines into a straight line, instead of the actual angle of the exterior of the vertex...

That seems... Oddly arbitrary, but it's been a while since I took a maths class so idk why you'd need that anymore

29.author: Carribean-Diver
29.body: I'm not sure where you're getting 300 from. All of the exterior angles on a triangle will add up to 360° (they must; otherwise, it wouldn't be closed). All of the interior angles on a triangle will add up to 180°. Since they are specifying a 'regular polygon' with three sides, it is necessarily an equilateral triangle. Thus, all 'interior' angles must be 60° and all 'exterior' must be 120°.

40.author: inanuttshell29
40.body: I guess even here I get bullied over nothing I did wrong, fml lol. Nothing new in my life.

40.author: inanuttshell29
40.body:
I have experienced it before that guys get so angry and irritated for no reason at all other than finding me unattractive so it just doesn't surprise me. It's true he can't exactly see the results of his bullying but he knows it's by definition not something that makes me happy when he makes sure all sorts of things related to being short or "ugly" pop up in my face all the time. Maybe just the mere thought of me getting hurt was enough for him. He probably felt so irritated or annoyed after spying on me through my phone camera and seeing my pictures, that he decided he wouldn't leave without any bullying.

Like I said, people and especially guys have always gone out of their way to make sure I feel like shit, motivated by nothing more than them finding me ugly. My whole highschool period consisted of this bullying. It's a shit world for females who are considered "ugly", especially when also short.

40.author: inanuttshell29
40.body:
When Googling the issue I do see some reports of other people whose hacker seemed to joke around by changing their predictive text/vocabulary shortcuts but most of the time it's not a personal attack which was the case with me. Like in those cases, for example the word "ok" would get turned into "cocaine".

And yeah leaving my Reddit app on pages/threads that have everything to do with ugliness is definitely more "creative" than usual for hackers. It only shows how much he must have hated me based on nothing but peeking at me through my camera...

42.author: boersc
42.body:
Eight million tons of plastic flow into the ocean every year, and straws comprise just 0.025 percent of that.
Source: National Geographic.https://www.nationalgeographic.com/environment/article/news-plastic-drinking-straw-history-ban

I call that a non-issue.

42.author: reserveduitser

42.author: boersc
42.body: No, totally disagree. Of course industries can be hit. It would easily have a multitude of the effect, but it would cost money and revenue. Civilians are easy targets.

42.author: reserveduitser

45.author: BullsSomerset
45.body:
I wanted to say the exact same thing. With Google, it should assist in 🧠 power, but ffs, if they changed it from air to gas, I wouldn't be commenting, I'm sure you wouldn't either, LOL.

Edit -- removed a useless sentence.

45.author: Giorgio243
45.body: Isn't air made up of 70%+ nitrogen?

45.author: BullsSomerset
45.body:
I don't want to go super nerd on you here, I'll try my best not to.  78% and yes you're right, however, nitrogen in its purest form (inert, super dry air) it doesn't support moisture or combustion.   In chemistry, you have to look at every molecule differently.  Here's another example -- again, sorry for nerding on you, lol.  Oxygen that we breath in binds with haemoglobin in our systym (blood) whereas nitrogen does not get to bind with blood, reason for is because it does not contain the binding protein complex to bind it. Again  humans are unable to utilize it in this manner, however it's still SUPER important as mixed nitrogen helps in amino acids that influence growth, hormones, brain function, etc.

In short -- If we were to mix just regular old air in bags of chips, they would mold because of oxidation.  We cannot utilize nitrogen itself when we inhale because it does not contain what we require.

Gdi.

Edit -- I wrote too many errors and removed some wordings.

45.author: Giorgio243
45.body: Yeah but surely it wouldn't take as much nitrogen as shown in the picture? It seems like overkill

45.author: BullsSomerset
45.body:
Np, sorry again for the long winded response.  Think of tire pressure.  Gases expand when heated and contract when cooled. Tire inflation pressure can rise and fall with changes in ambient temperature by a certain amount of psi (not sure on exact psi change). Bags in general with just nitrogen and exposed to different temperature changes will experience size changes. 

In short, heat in general will cause bags filled with nitrogen to expand. It's phenomenal to watch F1 racecar tires expand in slow motion as it heats up.  Take a watch sometime.

45.author: Giorgio243
45.body: So you're saying that this bag is in a hot environment? I guess that makes sense, but why would OP have such a warm house?

45.author: BullsSomerset
45.body:
Not necessarily, I didn't want to go full blown nerd.  Altitude plays a part too, LOL.  The ambient air pressure lessens as it rises in altitude.  Air pressure outside the bag is lesser than that of inside will expand in inflation size.

Honestly, OP could be living in hell or mount everest or could be just dumb luck with this bag when the amount of fixed nitrogen was less at the manufacturers and where it's coming from.

Edit -- removed a unnecessary sentence and to shorten it because I have to return to work, lol.

45.author: Giorgio243

56.body:
I’ve tried, but you keep replying with nonsense. 

Notice how it wasn’t just me downvoting? That’s because you were wrong. But you keep doubling down. 

Idk what to tell you. Maybe Reddit isn’t the place for you.

56.author: No-Record-2773
56.body: What exactly was wrong?! Me wanting to make baby food from scratch for my future non existent children!? Is *that* what you’re so hung up on? Because I think it will be *healthier* to *know* what’s going into my food? At least the parts that I can control?! What *exactly* do you have a problem with?!

56.author: ChrisTackleberry
56.body:
You think you are controlling what goes into your food. That is ignorant. 

You aren’t paying labs to test this stuff. You are guessing, plain and simple. 

You previously stated that “your body needs lead to survive” 

Just quit. What you **think** you’re doing is a noble pursuit. But when you start pontificating, and only succeed in showing your ignorance, expect a reaction.

56.author: No-Record-2773
56.body: I get why it looks like I was agreeing with OP about zero lead. I get why I was downvoted. What I don’t get is why you’re so bored as to keep this up. Other than being a troll I can’t think of anything.

56.author: No-Record-2773
56.body: Officially blocked. I’m not letting you ruin my day any longer.

64.author: PixelPervert
64.body: USB C to A is just stupid in my opinion but Apple lags behind with their cables

64.author: Neekalos_

64.author: PixelPervert
64.body: Because this is about how a USB A cable doesn't fit in a USB C port

64.author: Neekalos_
64.body: But what does that have to do with Apple?? They don't make USB-C to USB-A cables. They have had usb-c to lightning cables since 2018, and OP has an old-style cable that is lightning to USB-A, which is hardly Apple's fault for their choice of charger. I really don't see why this is so hard to understand.

65.author: TooDirty4Daylight
65.body:
Fuck any arbitrary cutoff date when they pull some BS....failing to disclose stuff is a really low-life sales tactic. A year commitment is a pretty important element of the plan....

Every little old lady sitting on a jury has seen this kind of BS and they are NOT pleased so Petco and/or their minions are in for it. Judges take a dim view too, LOL

65.author: Apprehensive_Hat_647
65.body: I’m definitely going to do this. I even tried calling the number in the email twice and the first time I didn’t get an answer and was told to call back and the second time they hung up on me after hearing that I wanted to cancel.

65.author: Apprehensive_Hat_647
65.body: They didn’t tell me it was for a set period of time at all which is the worst part. They presented it as something like Netflix that you can cancel anytime.

65.author: Apprehensive_Hat_647
65.body: They signed me up when I was checking out at the store and did their whole song and dance to get me to sign up. They didn’t mention a commitment but said “your total is $85 but with this plan it’ll be $56”

65.author: Apprehensive_Hat_647
65.body: The end of the billing cycle is fair because they still let you use Netflix until that date if you want. For Petco no where was it mentioned that it was a year long contract, the only option they give in their portal is to not auto renew for the next year so you have to email or call.

65.author: TooDirty4Daylight
65.body:
Seems like there's a law or an FTC rule that says they can't make it a PITA to cancel stuff like this and stuff with recurring billing.

Something about having to be as easy to cancel as it is to get started ....so they can't make you go to the main office at the North Pole  to stand on one leg and wave a dead chicken counterclockwise at the counter to summon a clerk.

67.author: GreeboPucker
67.body:
If you do that a couple of times it fucks with your ability to get legitimate returns and refunds, each account essentially has a budget for that.

It's better to 

A. Provide delivery instructions so you can

B. Review the driver as not following instructions but also 

C. Make sure you don't already have instructions that are two years old saying to leave shit at the garage that you forgot about.

67.author: GoldSolarBear
67.body: Dude that’s an OFFICIAL way of handling it and that sounds good but you can make as many returns as you need to if THEY keep making the mistakes that are the reason for the returns there’s no limit on that so idk what your talking about with that. Reviewing the driver is almost impossible as you would have to catch the driver and majority of the time the driver is going by direction of someone telling them to sit package elsewhere so it’s not their fault. Also a good way to not receive packages is to start giving your driver a hard time so that is IMO a horrible idea. So you pretty much said for them to provide delivery instructions which they have done already or talk to the driver which already has delivery instructions or to update delivery instructions which is what your already doing if you give delivery instruction. I honestly don’t think you’ve ever dealt with someone who is not listening to delivery instructions because giving them more does not work you have to COST them something for making their mistake and at the end of the day if they put your package in wrong spot their is no way for them to prove you received it… unless they take picture which only verifies wrong product placement COSTING them money on their mistake. That’s how you get company to get proactive about fixing an issue taking money out their pocket not talking to them reasonably…

67.author: GreeboPucker
67.body: Just to pull one thread, where exactly did you get the idea that the OP already gave delivery instructions?

67.author: GoldSolarBear
67.body: The IDEA came from in all fairness and assumption based on the fact that someone who is willing to make a post on Reddit with proper spelling and a convenient picture is probably the type of person to give delivery instruction. They seem reasonable so I skipped telling them give instructions because it would seem they would do that but i don’t 100% know you got me on that. That was 100% the correct thread to pull because your other suggestions won’t work… at all.

67.author: GreeboPucker
67.body: You do realize people get their Amazon accounts banned for reporting too many deliveries as missing or stolen. You can Google it and see people's personal experiences.

67.author: GoldSolarBear
67.body: If they make a mistake and rather then correct the mistake your gonna delete my account I don’t wanna go through the delivery service also they might have a bigger problem doing that

67.author: GreeboPucker
67.body:
The drivers are either employees of a 3rd party delivery small business, or gig workers; I don't know what factors, if any, determine which delivers each particular package. 

Neither are direct employees of Amazon, not a single one; nor do they have any control over your account, or whether to refund you for a missing item, or even know if you report an item missing, or has to pay for it directly if a package is missing or stolen. All that information is specifically and intentionally hidden from drivers.


Only Amazon can affect whether your account gets banned, and it's based on how many refunds you ask for over a period of time. Pretty much the same system applies to the drivers. Each package gets it's delivery signed by the account of the driver responsible, if too many of a drivers deliveries go missing or are stolen after the driver signs that they were delivered then that driver gets banned/fired.

When you report an item wasn't delivered or was stolen, it damages the driver's statistics for the week, but they have no idea which house out of the 1000 or so they delivered to that week had the problem. Even if you talk to a real person at customer support and complain, at no point does that feedback get to the driver. The best that might happen is that support will write a delivery note -for- you, which circles around to what I suggested in the first place.

The system is set up so that it's in the best interests of both drivers and customers that no packages go missing or get stolen. If either a driver or customer stands out statistically as a bad actor they get the ban.
